comments:
1. Select a folder containing SML documents to export
2. Select Export... from the context menu
3. Fill in appropriate values so you can advance to the 2nd page of the wizard
4. On page 2, select one of the detected documents
5. Add 4 aliases for the document
6. Holding down the Ctrl key, select the 2nd and 3rd aliases in the list
7. Click the Remove button

Observe that the resulting list does not result in the 1st and 4th alias from before, as expected.

Here's a relevant exception stack from the error log:

java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 1, Size: 1
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:572)
	at java.util.ArrayList.remove(ArrayList.java:415)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.smlif.internal.artifacts.ModelUnitFile.removeAlias(ModelUnitFile.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.smlif.internal.export.ui.ExportToSMLIFWizardPage2$4.widgetSelected(ExportToSMLIFWizardPage2.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:928)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3348)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2968)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:820)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:796)
    ...
There was a logic error in calculating the selected index when multiple items were selected.
